subject: Philosophy
title: Determinism
description: A fast breakdown of Determinism for builders.

hook.text: If every event has a cause, and causes stretch back to the Big Bang, was your life fixed from the start?

buildup.text: Determinism says the universe is a chain of causes and effects. No room for anything 'uncaused.'

discovery.text: Your decisions are caused by brain states, which are caused by genetics and experience â€” an unbroken chain.

twist.text: Quantum mechanics introduces randomness. But random isn't the same as free. A coin flip isn't a choice.

climax.text: Whether the universe is determined or random, neither seems to leave room for genuine free choice.

punchline.text: Cause or chance. Neither sounds like freedom.

quiz.question: Why doesn't quantum randomness solve the free will problem?
options: Random events aren't the same as deliberate choices
Quantum effects don't reach the brain
